author: m4dm4n
body:
# Steps to reproduce

When creating a new local user via New-LocalUser cmdlet with password, property RequiredPassword gives value $false, although password IS required when attempting to logon.

```
New-LocalUser -Name "Test1" -Password $Password

Get-LocalUser Test1 | Format-List

AccountExpires         : 
Description            :
Enabled                : True
FullName               :
PasswordChangeableDate : 2/27/2020 12:25:25 PM
PasswordExpires        : 4/9/2020 1:25:25 PM
UserMayChangePassword  : True
**PasswordRequired       : False**
PasswordLastSet        : 2/27/2020 12:25:25 PM
LastLogon              :
Name                   : Test1
SID                    : S-1-5-21-2902974129-3397675831-214796114-1009
PrincipalSource        : Local
ObjectClass            : User

```

But, when creating new user via "net user" command, RequiredPassword property show expected $true value

```
net user Test2 * /ADD

Get-LocalUser Test2 | Format-List

AccountExpires         : 
Description            : 
Enabled                : True
FullName               : 
PasswordChangeableDate : 2/27/2020 12:27:16 PM
PasswordExpires        : 4/9/2020 1:27:16 PM
UserMayChangePassword  : True
**PasswordRequired       : True**
PasswordLastSet        : 2/27/2020 12:27:16 PM
LastLogon              : 
Name                   : Test2
SID                    : S-1-5-21-2902974129-3397675831-214796114-1010
PrincipalSource        : Local
ObjectClass            : User

```

# Expected behavior

After creating a user, property PasswordRequired should be true.

# Actual behavior

After creating a user, property PasswordRequired is false.

# Additional data

You can clearly see that this property has a set option, but there is no way to actually set it to $true or $false.

```
Get-LocalUser | Get-Member -Name PasswordRequired                 

   TypeName: Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.LocalUser
Name             MemberType Definition
----             ---------- ----------
PasswordRequired Property   bool PasswordRequired {get;set;}

```

So basically, when creating a user via New-LocalUser with password, property PasswordRequired should automatically be set to True value. 


# Environment data

```

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.2.4
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.2.4
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18362
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: jhoneill
comments.body:
IIRC if "require password" is false the user can set an empty password.  It is not "currently has an empty password".  

I can't offer a reason why one tool forbids local users to set null passwords and the other allows it. Possibly because it should be set by a global policy not user-by-user.

comments.author: m4dm4n

**PasswordRequired       : True**

On the first logon, I didn't have to add any password. So it's not really an requirement, nor an information, I think something somewhere is broken.
